Monsters.name: Goblin
Monsters.description: A foul green monster stands about 4 feet tall in front of you. His odor is that of spoiled meat and fecal matter. He has a scimitar in hand and attempts to charge you. Do you want to Attack them or try to Leave?
Monsters.combat: The Goblin faces you down, how would you like to attack?
Monsters.prelude: A strange smell of waste comes from this direction. There are high pitched giggles and snarls. Something just sneezed violently.
Monsters.attack: The Goblin swings its scimitar wildly in your direction!

Monsters.name: Zombie
Monsters.description: A mass of rotten skin, explosed muscle and protruding bones stands before you. Whoever this person was before, they are now an undead abomination. Do you want to Attack them or try to Leave?
Monsters.combat: The Zombie is shambling towards you, how would you like to attack?
Monsters.prelude: The smell of rotten flesh accompanies low, gutteral moans. Something is shambling in here.
Monsters.attack: The Zombie charges you, attempting to slam and bite you with what remains of its jaw.

Monsters.name: Cambion
Monsters.description: A strikingly beautiful man stands before you. Large, bat-like wings sprout from his back. His skin is as red as an apple and large curved ram horns protrude from its forehead. Do you want to Attack them or try to Leave?
Monsters.combat: The Cambion aproaches you, mocking laugher coming from his wicked grin. He readies his claws. How would you like to attack?
Monsters.prelude: The air is thick with oppressive heat and a strange red glow. You think you smell sulphur.
Monsters.attack: The Cambion slashes at your with its claws.

NPC.name: Gertrude
NPC.description: A strange woman dressed in an ill fitted wedding dress stands before you. 'Are you here to try and marry me as well? The last person who tried just died! HAH! You'll be next if you aren't careful! I'll show you! I will! Don't test me!' How do you want to respond? You could Attack her, try to Calm her down, Leave her to her devices or Seduce her.
NPC.prelude: you hear sounds of someone crying. It is a deep, low sob intermixed with light giggling.
NPC.attack: The woman swings wildly at you with a dagger!
NPC.combat: The woman weilds her dagger and stands ready to fight back.
NPC.option1Good: Thank you, I've calmed a little. This was my Mother's doing, you know. She always wished for me to marry. Now I'm a murderer. You were kind--I want you to have this.
NPC.option1Bad: `You presume much about me! What could you even know! GET AWAY FROM ME!` You should probably Leave.
NPC.option2Good: My, what a charmer you are! Maybe romance isn't dead after all. Here, I want you to have this. Find me when we both get out of here, but Leave me for now. I need to clear my head.
NPC.option2Bad: You disgust me. you need to Leave now before I make you regret your advances.

NPC.name: Bandit
NPC.description: Standing before you seems to be a vagabond currently looting the corpse of another person. This now dead individual seems to have been a merchant of some kind. The man says: 'what you lookin at? Best get walking on if you know whats good for ya!' You could Attack him, try to Negotiate with him, Leave him or Seduce him.
NPC.prelude: You hear what sounds like a man muttering to himself. There is the jingling of coin and the clang of metal.
NPC.attack: The Bandit swings at you with his longsword.
NPC.combat: The Bandit readies his longsword and enters into a combat stance.
NPC.option1Good: 'Fine, take this and go about your day.' You should probably Leave.
NPC.option1Bad: 'Piss off ya greedy loser! This was my kill, I'll not have you stealing from me. Just Leave.'
NPC.option2Good: 'Took me a second, but you're hitting on me aren't you? I'll not lie it has been some time since I tumbled, but now's not the right moment. Tell ya what, head to Lower Lantern and ask for the 'Proper Piss Water' at the bar. That's our hang out. Take this, as a favor from me.' You should probably Leave.
NPC.option2Bad: 'You some kind of freak? Get away from me you weirdo.'

NPC.name: Motley Jester
NPC.description: A strange man dressed only in rags dances before you. He is missing a large chunk of his nose, and his face is tattooed like that of a motley vest. Through a smile he sings: 'Under the sea, smoke rises in bubbles, and flames burn green and blue and black! I know, I know, oh, oh, oh!'  You could Attack him, try to Understand him, Leave him or Seduce him.
NPC.prelude: You hear the sounds of dancing, and someone singing to them selves. There is the jingling of coin and the clang of metal.
NPC.attack: The Motley Jester sends a roundhouse kick in your direction!
NPC.combat: The Motley Jester giggles and laughs, singing: 'In the dark the dead are dancing! I know, I know, oh oh oh! And goads you to attack him.
NPC.option1Good: 'Under the sea the mermen feast on starfish soup, and all the serving men are crabs.' He seems to materialize something from under his rags. You should probably Leave.
NPC.option1Bad: 'Fool's blood. King's blood, but chains for the guests and chains for the bridegroom, aye, aye, aye.' You can't understand a thing he is saying. You should probably just Leave him alone.
NPC.option2Good: 'The shadows come to dance, my lord, dance my lord, dance my lord. The shadows come to stay, my lord, stay my lord, stay my lord.' He doesn't seem to understand your advances, but does hand you something. You should probably Leave.
NPC.option2Bad: 'The crow, the crow. Under the sea the crows are white as snow! I know, I know, oh, oh, oh!' He doesn't seem to even know you are here. It's probably time to Leave him be.

Puzzle.name: Magic Mirror
Puzzle.description: A massive mirror sits in the room, reflecting everything else around you. In the room, and reflected in the mirror, are three other items. A stray Sock, a half eaten can of baked Beans, and a rusty Horseshoe. Something seems out of place. What would you like to do? You can Leave, look for a Hint, or try to solve it by putting in what you think the answer is.
Puzzle.prelude: you see something is sending back a reflection of yourself.
Puzzle.hint: Looking in the mirror, the horseshoe is reflecting incorrectly from the mirror!
Puzzle.hintFailure: Looking in the mirror and at your suroundings yields no insights. You decide to give up on that and are left with guessing between the sock, Beans and Horseshoe. You can always just Leave.
Puzzle.correct: After placing the horseshoe in the correct spot, something falls out of the mirror!

Puzzle.name: Clock Riddle
Puzzle.description: In a small lounge area sits a carpet, a grandfather clock, a coffee table and a loveseat. The grandfather clock rhythmically ticks away the time. On the coffe table you spot a piece of parchment, on it written: `What falls but never breaks? What breaks but never falls?` What would you like to do? You can Leave, look for a Hint, or try to guess.
Puzzle.prelude: you hear the low methodic ticking of a clock.
Puzzle.hint: The grandfather clock counts down time, you think to yourself. Night falls and day breaks. Night and day!
Puzzle.correct: After declaring your answer, the grandfather clock opens up to reveal a hidden compartment!

Puzzle.name: The Knave, Knight and Spy
Puzzle.description: In this room rests a very large painting of three men. Each of them makes a statement about one of the others, or themselves. Robert says: 'Tobias is a knave.' Paris says: `Robert is a knight.' Tobias says: 'I am a spy.' The Knave always lies, the Knight always tells the truth and the spy can sometimes lie or tell the truth. Who is the Spy? What would you like to do? You can Leave, look for a Hint, or try to guess.
Puzzle.prelude: You notice what seems to be a huge mural or painting in this direction.
Puzzle.hint: After pondering the painting for a while, it finally hits you. Paris must be the spy, because Robert must be telling the truth and Tobias must be lying. It's Paris!
Puzzle.correct: After declaring your answer, Paris the spy deteriorates off the painting, revealing a hidden compartment!

Treasure.name: Treasure Chest
Treasure.description: A large, very heavy trunk sits in front of you. There is a lock on it. What would you like to do? You could Bash it open, Leave it alone, try to Pick the lock, or use a Key if you have one.
Treasure.prelude: the room seems oddly quiet. There is no odor or sights that immediately catch your attention.
Treasure.option1Good: You manage to successfully destroy the lock, recieving the truck's content.
Treasure.option1Bad: You completely fail to destroy the lock, and now you've hurt yourself.
Treasure.option2Good: You manage to finagle the lock open, recieving the truck's content.
Treasure.option2Bad: After trying for several minutes, you fail to pick the lock.
Treasure.option3Good: The key fits! you recieve the truck's content.

Treasure.name: Armory
Treasure.description: Inside this room rests an armory of sorts. Nearly everything has rusted away, save what seems to be a decent banded Shield. It rests behind iron bars that have been locked. What would you like to do? You could Bash it open, Leave it alone, try to Pick the lock, or use a Key if you have one.
Treasure.prelude: the room seems oddly quiet. There is no odor or sights that immediately catch your attention.
Treasure.option1Good: You manage to successfully destroy the lock, allowing you access inside.
Treasure.option1Bad: You completely fail to destroy the lock, and now you've hurt yourself.
Treasure.option2Good: You manage to finagle the lock, opening the iron gate.
Treasure.option2Bad: After trying for several minutes, you fail to pick the lock.
Treasure.option3Good: The key fits! you enter the iron cage.

Treasure.name: Wizard's Hovel
Treasure.description: The room radiates with magical energy. It is clear a wizard lived here long ago. Decayed books litter about the room. Sitting in a corner a small jewelry box rests. It seems it was haphazardly thrown down. It seems to have a magically enchanted lock on it. What would you like to do? You could Dissenchant it, Leave it alone, try to Bless it open, or use a Key if you have one.
Treasure.prelude: the room seems oddly quiet. There is no odor or sights that immediately catch your attention.
Treasure.option1Good: You manage to successfully dissenchant the spell, opening the box.
Treasure.option1Bad: You fail to dissenchant the lock, and the trap spell fires!
Treasure.option2Good: Calling on the power of your God, you dispell the enchantment and open the box.
Treasure.option2Bad: After trying for several minutes, you do not hear a response from your God.
Treasure.option3Good: The key fits! It seems to dissenchant the strange spell and the box opens.

Start.name: Prison Cell
Start.description: You awake to find yourself in a prison cell, the door left ajar. You have no memory of how you got to this place. Inside the room there is a bucket in the corner and your bunk bed. What would you like to do? You can Look inside of the bucket, Peek under the bed, Leave, or 'Use' the bucket.
Start.prelude: you become convinced you must be halucinating! It would seem you've returned to your old cell... (I'll write this out later, left for testing purposes)
Start.option1Good: You spot something shiny through the refuse! You dig on in and find a key. I'm sure that was sanitary. It may be a good time to Leave and find out what that key is for!
Start.option1Bad: You see something unpleasant. This bucket has been used very recently and frequently. Gross. Its probably time to Leave
Start.option2Bad: You find a dead rat and a lot of dust. You should probably just Leave.
Start.option2Good: Under the bed someone stashed what looks like a bag of coin tucked inside the bedframe. That was a lucky find, but its probably time to Leave.
Start.option3Good: An incredible use of your time. You feel 5 pounds lighter after relieving yourself. Maybe its about time to Leave.
Start.option3Bad: You strain and pull something as you squat awkwardly over the bucket. Maybe you should just Leave.
